bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Thomas O'Kane, 13 September 1873
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: extracted transcription from Major Authors cd

body.p: I have rec'd your letter of the 12th. I agree to allow you better than half off, namely you to acc'taccount to me at $1.40 ctscents a copy on the bound Leaves of Grass (which retails at $3)—and at 30 ctscents each for As a strong bird, (which retails at 75 ctscents.)
I will be very happy to see you, at any time. I am stopping at 322 Stevens st. Camden, (cross by Phil. ferry from foot of Market st.—or Camden depot from N. Y.)
If you are willing to go into selling my books, I think you ought to have some of the little 30 ctscents brochure "After All not to Create Only" published by Roberts Bros. Boston.
I do not of course expect the sale could any how be a rushing one—but
